actor_awards.notes: Weissmuller was a five-time Olympic Gold Medalist in swimming before his acting career. He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame at 6541 Hollywood Blvd. His portrayal of Tarzan is ranked as the #34 Hero on the AFI's '100 Years... 100 Heroes & Villains' list.

filmography.title: Tarzan the Ape Man
filmography.role_description: The definitive screen portrayal of the Lord of the Apes, a noble savage raised in the African jungle who rescues and falls for Jane Parker.
filmography.plot: A trader and his daughter set off in search of the fabled graveyard of the elephants in deepest Africa, only to encounter a wild man raised by apes.
filmography.awards: AFI: 100 Years... 100 Heroes & Villains (#34 Hero); AFI: Nominated for 100 Movies & 100 Quotes

filmography.title: Tarzan and His Mate
filmography.role_description: Tarzan returns to defend his jungle paradise and his wife Jane from greedy ivory hunters who threaten their idyllic life.
filmography.plot: The idyllic life of Tarzan and Jane is challenged by men on safari who come looking for ivory and come into conflict with the jungle inhabitants.

filmography.title: Tarzan Escapes
filmography.role_description: Tarzan must protect Jane from her scheming relatives who arrive in the jungle with plans to trick her into returning to civilization.
filmography.plot: Jane's cousins arrive in the African jungle to tell her about a fortune she has inherited and try to convince her to return to civilization.

filmography.title: Tarzan Finds a Son!
filmography.role_description: The Ape Man becomes a father figure when he and Jane rescue an infant survivor of a plane crash, naming him 'Boy'.
filmography.plot: Tarzan and Jane adopt a baby boy who survives a plane crash, but years later, a search party comes looking for the heir to a fortune.

filmography.title: Tarzan's Secret Treasure
filmography.role_description: Tarzan defends his family and the jungle's gold deposits from a scientific expedition that turns greedy upon discovering the treasure.
filmography.plot: An expedition team arrives in the jungle and discovers gold, leading them to kidnap Jane and Boy to force Tarzan to reveal the location of the treasure.

filmography.title: Tarzan's New York Adventure
filmography.role_description: A fish-out-of-water role where Tarzan travels to New York City, wearing a suit and navigating skyscrapers to rescue Boy from a circus.
filmography.plot: Tarzan and Jane travel to New York City to rescue Boy, who has been kidnapped by a circus owner who wants to use him as an act.

filmography.title: Tarzan Triumphs
filmography.role_description: Tarzan abandons his isolationist stance to fight Nazi paratroopers who have invaded the hidden city of Palandrya.
filmography.plot: Tarzan battles Nazi agents who have parachuted into the jungle to enslave a lost civilization and exploit its oil resources.

filmography.title: Tarzan's Desert Mystery
filmography.role_description: Tarzan crosses a desert to find malaria medicine for Allied troops, battling prehistoric creatures and giant spiders along the way.
filmography.plot: Tarzan receives a letter from Jane asking for jungle medicine for feverish troops, leading him on a quest that involves dinosaurs and giant spiders.

filmography.title: Tarzan and the Amazons
filmography.role_description: Tarzan tries to prevent a group of archaeologists from looting the hidden city of Palmyria, ruled by a tribe of Amazon women.
filmography.plot: Tarzan rescues an Amazon woman from a panther and returns her to her hidden city, but trouble follows when outsiders try to steal the city's gold.

filmography.title: Tarzan and the Leopard Woman
filmography.role_description: Tarzan faces a deadly cult of warriors who wear leopard skins and iron claws to attack caravans and travelers.
filmography.plot: Tarzan fights to protect a trading caravan from a cult of leopard-worshipping natives who are terrorizing the jungle.

filmography.title: Tarzan and the Huntress
filmography.role_description: Tarzan defends the jungle animals from a zoological expedition looking to capture specimens for zoos after the war.
filmography.plot: A female animal trainer arrives in the jungle to capture animals for zoos, but Tarzan intervenes to protect his animal friends.

filmography.title: Tarzan and the Mermaids
filmography.role_description: In his final film as Tarzan, Weissmuller travels to a coastal village to save a woman from being forced to marry a false god.
filmography.plot: Tarzan travels to a forbidden island to rescue a woman who is being forced to marry a 'god' who is actually a pearl thief.

filmography.title: Jungle Jim
filmography.role_description: Weissmuller's first outing as the intrepid guide and adventurer, leading a scientist into the jungle to find a cure for polio.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim leads a scientist into the jungle to find a rare drug that could cure polio, while battling witch doctors and treasure hunters.

filmography.title: The Lost Tribe
filmography.role_description: Jungle Jim protects a hidden African city from white men seeking to exploit its diamond riches.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim fights to save a lost city from greedy white men who want to plunder its diamonds.

filmography.title: Mark of the Gorilla
filmography.role_description: Jim uncovers a gang of gold thieves who are disguising themselves as gorillas to scare away the natives and steal treasure.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim discovers that a group of 'gorillas' terrorizing the jungle are actually men in suits looking for Nazi gold.

filmography.title: Captive Girl
filmography.role_description: Jim helps a feral 'jungle girl' who has been raised by a tiger and is believed to be a witch by the local tribes.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim investigates a legend of a leopard woman and discovers a feral girl raised by animals who is being targeted by treasure hunters.

filmography.title: Pygmy Island
filmography.role_description: Jungle Jim helps the U.S. government find a lost WAC captain and fights foreign agents on an island inhabited by pygmies.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim helps the military search for a missing WAC who has information on a valuable plant fiber needed for the war effort.

filmography.title: Fury of the Congo
filmography.role_description: Jim tracks down a gang of drug smugglers who are capturing the sacred 'Okongo' antelope to extract a narcotic from its glands.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim encounters a tribe of Amazon women and helps them fight off men who are hunting a sacred beast for its glands.

filmography.title: Jungle Manhunt
filmography.role_description: Jim helps a football player search for a missing doctor in the jungle, encountering a tribe that creates synthetic diamonds.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim aids a former football star in finding a missing photographer in a jungle inhabited by dinosaurs and rock men.

filmography.title: Jungle Jim in the Forbidden Land
filmography.role_description: Jim leads an anthropologist into a land of giants to find evidence of their existence, fighting off poachers along the way.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim guides an anthropologist to a land of giant people while fighting off ivory poachers.

filmography.title: Voodoo Tiger
filmography.role_description: Jim is hired to accompany a museum expedition but gets entangled with Nazis and headhunters in the jungle.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim guides a museum curator through the jungle, dealing with headhunters and Nazis who are trying to steal art treasures.

filmography.title: Savage Mutiny
filmography.role_description: Jim is tasked with relocating natives from an island scheduled for an atomic bomb test while fighting enemy agents.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim tries to evacuate natives from an island being used for atomic testing while fighting off foreign spies.

filmography.title: Valley of Head Hunters
filmography.role_description: Jim helps the government negotiate mineral rights with a local tribe while stopping corrupt businessmen from inciting a war.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim and a government agent try to secure rights to a mineral-rich valley, but bad guys try to start a war with headhunters to stop them.

filmography.title: Killer Ape
filmography.role_description: Jim battles a giant man-ape creature and mad scientists who are experimenting on animals in the jungle.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim investigates reports of a giant man-ape and uncovers a plot by mad scientists to use animals for germ warfare.

filmography.title: Jungle Man-Eaters
filmography.role_description: Jim investigates a diamond smuggling ring led by a man who can control a killer lion.
filmography.plot: Jungle Jim tracks down a diamond smuggler who uses a killer lion to eliminate anyone who gets in his way.

filmography.title: Cannibal Attack
filmography.role_description: Playing a character named after himself (but essentially Jungle Jim), he investigates cobalt thefts in a region plagued by 'cannibal' crocodile men.
filmography.plot: Johnny Weissmuller investigates the theft of cobalt shipments and discovers a tribe of men who dress as crocodiles.

filmography.title: Devil Goddess
filmography.role_description: In his final feature film role, Weissmuller guides a professor to a fire god's shrine, battling treasure hunters along the way.
filmography.plot: Johnny Weissmuller helps a professor find a rare friend in the jungle while fighting off treasure hunters seeking a fire god's fortune.

filmography.title: Stage Door Canteen
filmography.role_description: A memorable cameo appearance where the famous Tarzan actor is seen working in the kitchen washing dishes to support the war effort.
filmography.plot: A musical variety film featuring numerous celebrity cameos entertaining American and Allied servicemen during World War II.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated â€“ Best Music (Scoring), Best Original Song

filmography.title: Swamp Fire
filmography.role_description: A psychologically scarred bar pilot in Louisiana who tries to regain his nerve and save his friends from a devastating fire.
filmography.plot: A bayou pilot loses his nerve after a crash but must regain his courage to fight a massive fire threatening his home and friends.

filmography.title: Glorifying the American Girl
filmography.role_description: Weissmuller's film debut, appearing as a scantily clad 'Adonis' in a musical tableau, showcasing the physique that would make him famous.
filmography.plot: A musical revue film produced by Florenz Ziegfeld highlighting the Ziegfeld Follies, featuring various skits and musical numbers.

filmography.title: Won Ton Ton: The Dog Who Saved Hollywood
filmography.role_description: Weissmuller's final film appearance, a brief cameo as a stagehand in this comedy spoofing Old Hollywood.
filmography.plot: A German Shepherd dog becomes a major movie star in 1920s Hollywood, but fame brings its own set of problems.
